explanation.title: Summary of Research Article
explanation.text: The article reports on the identification of mutations in two aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases (ARSs) that are associated with autosomal recessive intellectual disability (ARID). The study was conducted on two Iranian families affected by ARID. The authors used homozygosity mapping, next-generation sequencing, and Sanger sequencing to identify mutations in the SARS (Seryl-tRNA synthetase) and WARS2 (WARS2 tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase) genes.
key_points: Mutations in SARS and WARS2 genes associated with ARID
Homozygosity mapping, next-generation sequencing, and Sanger sequencing used to identify mutations
Compound heterozygous genotype (c.325delA, p.Ser109Alafs*15) identified in the WARS2 gene
Frameshift mutation likely leads to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay, while missense mutation affects mitochondrial localization signal of WARS2
